problems.title: Roomba won't charge / Charging Error
problems.description: The robot is on the dock but the light doesn't pulse, or it says 'Charging Error'.
solution_steps: Clean the metal charging contacts on the Home Base and the bottom of the robot with a melamine foam (Magic Eraser) or alcohol wipe.
Remove the battery cover and ensure the battery is seated.
If the battery is over 2 years old, it likely needs replacement.

problems.title: Brushes Not Spinning / Poor Pickup
problems.description: The robot runs but leaves dirt behind. The side brush or main rollers aren't turning.
solution_steps: Unscrew the side brush and remove hair wrapped around the shaft.
Open the brush frame and remove the two main brushes. Clean the yellow bearings.
Replace brushes if the rubber is worn or bristles are missing.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a Roomba 694 Robot Vacuum?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $390 vacuum, and extending the life of your iRobot is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my Roomba 694 Robot Vacuum needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include reduced performance and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my Roomba 694 Robot Vacuum myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
